newsitem.title: BELGIUM: BELGIAN C.BANK REVISES 96 GROWTH FORECAST UPWARDS.
newsitem.headline: BELGIAN C.BANK REVISES 96 GROWTH FORECAST UPWARDS.

text.p: The Belgian central bank has revised its forecast for 1996 real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth to 1.4 percent, from 1.2 percent, figures published in the Belgian Primary Dealers Association's newsletter showed.
A central bank spokesman confirmed the new forecast.
The central bank's 1.2 percent forecast dates from August 14.
The 15 banks who are primary dealers in Belgian state debt also revised their forecast for 1996 real GDP growth to 1.5 percent from 1.3 percent in September.
"Recent indicators suggest that the economy will continue to recover during the second half of 1996 and throughout 1997," the primary dealers' Belgian Financial Newsletter said.
The primary dealers also revised their forecast for 1997 growth to 2.3 percent, from 2.1 percent in September.
The European Commission in November forecast the Belgian economy would grow 1.4 percent in 1996 and 2.2 percent in 1997.
